definition: bound hand and foot (idiom); constrained
to withdraw/to pull back/to contract/to shrink/to reduce/abbreviation/also pr. [su4]
hand/(formal) to hold/person engaged in certain types of work/person skilled in certain types of work/personal(ly)/convenient/classifier for skill/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]
to withdraw/to pull back/to contract/to shrink/to reduce/abbreviation/also pr. [su4]
foot/leg (of an animal or an object)/base (of an object)/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]/classifier for kicks

sentences.english: Stop pussyfooting around and say what you mean.
sentences.chinese: 别那么缩手缩脚的，说说你到底是什么意思。

sentences.english: We were a bit inhibited - and dependent on every-thing he did and his demands.
sentences.chinese: 我们有点缩手缩脚，依赖他的发挥和指挥。

sentences.english: Be bold in doing your work and don't be overcautious.
sentences.chinese: 工作你尽管大胆去干，别缩手缩脚的。

sentences.english: Who drink the grape wine are mostly those overcautious people.
sentences.chinese: 谁喝葡萄酒的人大多是那些缩手缩脚。

definition: afraid of the head, terrified of the tail (idiom); ever fearful and nervous/afraid of the slightest thing
cowering/cringing
to cower/to flinch/to quail/to recoil
to look forward and back/to consider prudently/overcautious
lit. to fear the wolf in front and the tiger behind (idiom)/fig. to be full of needless fears/reds under the beds
pinyin: qian2 pa4 lang2 hou4 pa4 hu3

definition: timidity/timid/cowardly
to have free rein (idiom)
to shrink back in fear (idiom); too cowardly to advance
timid/to be afraid of getting involved/to be afraid of getting into trouble
to stand still without advancing (idiom); to hesitate and hold back
to be a yes-man
timid/gutless/weakling
chicken-hearted (idiom)/gutless
no room to advance or to retreat (idiom); at a loss/in a hopeless situation
timid/weak
trembling with fear/with fear and trepidation
